page.title: 08STRATFORD CATTLE MARKET
page.content: On Tuesdays in Stratford is a Cattle Market,{pigs, sheep}&{cattle}are sold. They arrive by lorry,each kind of animal is put in an area of pens in groups.To be sorted sheep are dabbed with paint,pigs are sprayed and cattle have labels with numbers on.When the auctioneers are ready to auction they ring a bell.Sheep and pigs are sold from pens and the{auctioneers}walk along planks above calling out a price for each animal.Farmers bid for animals,but instead of calling they use a special signal.Small pigs are Â£40,big pigs are Â£120 and sheep Â£30. Cattle are sold by weight,and cost Â£600.It opens at 9am.They stop{selling cattle at 12pm, sheep and pigs at 1pm. Sheep have big holes punched in 1 ear after they are sold because farmers can claim a subsidy, this stops the possibility of them claiming it twice.
